column4: Confirms whether the applicant meets the minimum credit bureau score threshold required to proceed with credit assessment.
column6: 2.4.3.1 Credit score must > 350 (Except for some specialist loans or approved by a Level 1 DLA holder)

column4: Confirms that a current and usable credit bureau report with sufficient identity information is available for assessment.
column6: 2.4.1.1 Report must < 60 days old from hr approval

column4: Confirms that identity verification and AML screening requirements have been satisfied.
column6: 2.4.2.1 >= 3 identity particulas relating to the borrowers information on the credit report
2.4.12.1 The AML credit report must return a “No Match” against databases supplied by OFAC and DFAT
2.4.12.2 Where the AML credit report does not return a “No Match”, the matter must be referred to a Level 1 DLA holder

column4: Confirms that the applicant is not subject to an active formal insolvency arrangement.
column6: 2.4.9.2 Active Part X arrangements are generally considered high-risk and may require stricter terms or be ineligible for certain products
2.4.10.6 The current status of the bankruptcy must be confirmed (active, discharged, or annulled); borrowers in active bankruptcy are ineligible for mortgages
